triples.name: SYK model
triples.relevance: The SYK model is the main example system studied for analyzing quantum complexity in chaotic systems.

triples.name: Quantum complexity theory
triples.relevance: The paper proposes new understanding of quantum complexity growth in time evolution and relates it to complexity class separations.

triples.name: Unitary operator
triples.relevance: The paper studies minimal geodesics on the manifold of unitary operators representing time evolution.

triples.name: Hilbert space
triples.relevance: Hilbert space is the fundamental mathematical framework for quantum mechanics in which unitary operators act.

triples.name: Euler-Arnold equation
triples.relevance: The Euler-Arnold formalism is used to demonstrate the existence and properties of geodesics in the unitary operator manifold.

triples.name: Stationary state
triples.relevance: Energy eigenstates are fundamental to the Eigenstate Complexity Hypothesis which bounds overlap with k-local operators.

triples.name: Geodesic
triples.relevance: Minimal geodesics on the unitary manifold directly measure quantum circuit complexity and relate to time evolution.

triples.name: Time evolution
triples.relevance: The paper studies quantum complexity of time evolution in chaotic systems governed by the Schr√∂dinger equation.

triples.name: Holographic principle
triples.relevance: Holographic duality predictions about complexity growth are used to validate the theoretical predictions for the SYK model.

triples.name: PSPACE
triples.relevance: The paper discusses implications for PSPACE complexity class separations and comparisons with quantum complexity classes.

triples.name: BQP
triples.relevance: The paper examines hypothesized separations between PSPACE and BQP/poly related to computational complexity of quantum systems.

triples.name: Hamiltonian (quantum mechanics)
triples.relevance: The Hamiltonian operator generates time evolution and its structure determines the complexity growth in chaotic systems.

triples.name: Chaos theory
triples.relevance: The paper studies quantum complexity specifically in large-N chaotic systems and their contrast with integrable systems.

triples.name: Eigenstate Complexity Hypothesis
triples.relevance: ECH is a new criterion proposed by the paper that bounds overlaps between energy eigenstates and k-local operators.
